articles.author: Katelyn Polantz, CNN Reporter, Crime and Justice
articles.title: Judge to hold hearing on request to unseal Mar-a-Lago affidavit
articles.description: The federal magistrate judge who approved the Mar-a-Lago search warrant will hold a hearing Thursday at the court in Florida to discuss requests to unseal investigators' probable cause affidavit, which the Justice Department has opposed releasing.

articles.author: By Elise Hammond, Angela Fritz, Rachel Ramirez and Ella Nilsen, CNN
articles.title: Lake Mead water levels: Live updates
articles.description: The US Bureau of Reclamation is releasing a new report that will show the forecast for the Colorado River and Lake Mead. The findings could mean water cuts for millions living in several Southwest states starting in 2023. Follow here for live news updates.
articles.content: The federal government announced Tuesday the Colorado River will operate in a Tier 2 shortage condition for the first time starting in January as the Wests historic drought has taken a severe toll on… [+2074 chars]

articles.author: By Hafsa Khalil, CNN
articles.title: Drought reveals Welsh village submerged by reservoir in 19th century
articles.description: Unlike the lost city of Atlantis, when this 19th century Welsh village was submerged underwater, it only took a dry spell for it to resurface and reveal its ruins.
articles.content:
London (CNN) Unlike the lost city of Atlantis, when this 19th century Welsh village was submerged underwater, it only took a dry spell for it to resurface and reveal its ruins.

articles.title: Think it's hot now? New report shows it's only going to get hotter - CNN Video
articles.description: CNN meteorologist Chad Myers breaks down a new study warning of an 'extreme heat belt' that will impact over 100 million Americans by 2053.

articles.title: Coastal erosion is the latest battle for the U.S. island caught in the crosshairs of climate change - CNN Video
articles.description: Puerto Rico, which is battered by hurricanes and threatened by sea level rise, is experiencing coastal erosion at an alarming rate, scientists warn.

articles.author: Rachel Ramirez, CNN
articles.title: The West's historic drought is threatening hydropower at Hoover Dam
articles.description: The Hoover Dam can produce enough electricity for roughly 1.3 million Americans each year. But that power is dwindling.

articles.author: By Kathleen Magramo
articles.title: Live updates: Russia's war in Ukraine
articles.description: An explosion at an ammunition depot in the village of Maiskoye in Crimea injured at least two people, the head of the Russian-controlled Crimea administration Sergei Aksyonov said in his Telegram channel. Follow here for the latest from Ukraine.

articles.title: An 'extreme heat belt' will impact over 100 million Americans in the next 30 years, study finds
articles.description: Worsening heat and humidity as a result of climate change will bring extremely dangerous heat indices to much of the United States in the next 30 years, increasing both the intensity and frequency of the hottest days of the year, according to a new study publ…

articles.author: Opinion by Adam Sobel
articles.title: Opinion: The Inflation Reduction Act is a huge victory in this existential fight
articles.description: But in a time when the twin, slow-moving catastrophes that are US politics and the global climate crisis make it so painful for so many of us to read the news, it's important to take a moment and celebrate when something good happens, writes Adam Sobel.
